result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:12 PM Defendant Marcus Crosby appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Marcus Crosby.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Dr. Jeffrey Washelesky appears by zoom.
Court finds the technology meets the minimum standards for video conferencing. 
Case called for evidentiary hearing requested by the Defense. State objects to holding an evidentiary hearing at this time.
Court finds that this Court does not have standing to address this at this time. 
Another report should be received in December for Review.
Review hearing scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Review hearing on December 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Letter from ADA Thompson requesting that the Court deny the defendant's request for a hearing in this case.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 10/31/2022 - The Court will address at the start of the hearing today whether the defendant is entitled to a contested hearing given the procedural posture of this case.**
Per order of Judge Dorow on 10/19/2022 - the defendant will no longer be produced, and will appear by Zoom for the upcoming hearing instead.

Letter from Dr. Schick-Ndlovu at MMHI requesting that the defendant be permitted to appear via Zoom for the upcoming competency hearing.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 10/19/2022 - The request is approved. Mr. Crosby is to appear by Zoom for the 10/31 hearing, and as such the orders to produce will be cancelled in each of his cases.**

Letter from ADA Thompson to the Court requesting that Dr. Washelesky be permitted to testify via Zoom for the competency hearing.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 10/19/2022 - Approved.**
Competency hearing on October 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:21 PM; Case called for Review hearing. Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marcus Crosby appeared by Zoom video means, in custody at Mendota.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Marcus Crosby.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Court has received and reviewed the report by Dr. Washelesky, filed on 9/14/22, and confirms with counsel they have also received the report.  Court inquires if the defendant has received a copy of the report.  Defendant advises he has not.  Atty. Gutierrez advises he attempted to set up a meeting to discuss the report with the defendant but was not able to do so.  Atty. Gutierrez presents statements with respect to the report and notes there has since been in finding in the defendant's other cases that he is not competent and not likely to become competent within the statutory time frame.  

State has reviewed the report and are not objecting to the findings.  Atty. Gutierrez is objecting to the finding that the defendant will be found competent with treatment within the statutory time frame based on the finding in cases 22CM114 & 22CM169.  Atty. Gutierrez is asking the matter be set for an evidentiary hearing which will take about 1 hour.  Court confirms the issue is that the defendant will regain competency within the statutory time period.  Atty. Gutierrez confirms.  Court inquires if this matter needs to be set for evidentiary hearing back before Branch 2.  Counsel believe it should.  Court will have counsel report to the clerk's office to discuss scheduling with Branch 2's clerk.  Court notes at due to possible scheduling issues this court would be willing to hear the evidentiary hearing but Atty. Gutierrez would need to discuss that with his client and they would need to agree to allow this court to hear the matter if needed.  Atty. Gutierrez is aware.  Court will adjourn for evidentiary hearing before Branch 2.

IT IS ORDERED that the appeals 2022AP924-CR and 2022AP943-CR shall be decided by a three-judge panel.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that appeals 2022AP924-CR, 2022AP943-CR and 2022AP1109-CR are consolidated for purposes of briefing and disposition. Wis. Stat. Rule 809.10(3) (2019-20).

IT IS ORDERED that the motion to supplement the record on appeal in 2022AP924 is granted. The clerk of circuit court shall transmit the following transcripts to the clerk of this court by supplemental return within ten days of the date of this order: February 21, March 9, May 19, June 1, and June 3, 2022.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the appellant's brief is due forty days from the date the clerk of this court received the supplemental return. See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.82(2)(a) (2019-20).
filed by Dr. Jeffrey M. Washelesky, Psy.D.

11:39 AM Defendant Marcus Crosby in court, in custody from Mendota, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Marcus Crosby appeared by video means with Attorney.
Cases called for Motion Hearing to address the Motion to Stay the Involuntary Medication Order filed in 22CF954 on 7/05/22.
Other cases are tagging along.
State is in compliance with Victim's rights.
Defense has filed an appeal regarding the Involuntary Medication Order. 
State opposes the Motion for reasons as stated on the record. 
Defense makes arguments on the record in favor of Staying the Involuntary Medication Order. 
Although muted in the courtroom, the Defendant was removed from the hearing by staff at Mendota after repeated outbursts and agitated behaviors.
Court denies the motion for reasons as stated and places findings on the record. 
Court will address the State's Motion to Require Testing and Authorizing Test Results to be Provided to the Victim at Motion hearing scheduled for 7/29/22.

IT IS ORDERED that the appellant shall file a statement on transcript no later than July 29, 2022. See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.82(2)(a).
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED  that the time under Wis. Stat. Rule 809.30(2)(k), for the circuit clerk to transmit the record the record is extended, and the record shall be transmitted within twenty days after the filing of the transcript designated in the statement on transcript or within twenty days after the filing of a statement on transcript indicating that no transcript is necessary for prosecution of the appeal.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: From Competency Hearing.

10:46 AM Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court.   Defendant Marcus Crosby did not appear in a facility and refusing to appear via Zoom.    ADA Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dr. Michelle Hume appeared by Zoom.  Dr. Andressa Medrado Bias Silviera appeared by Zoom.  Dr. Tom DeBoer appeared by Zoom.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.
Attorney Hume is requesting an order for involuntary administration of medication. 
Attorney Gutierrez presents statements that there should be a competency hearing before an an order for involuntary administration of medication can be made and requests to adjourn for a contested competency hearing.
The Court notes that the Defendant is forfeiting his right to be at this hearing today and denies the request to adjourn and will proceed with a contested competency hearing.
The Court finds good cause that all the doctors appear via Zoom.
Attorney Gutierrez places his objections on the record again.
The Court will still proceed with a contested competency hearing.

Dr. Andressa Medrado Bias Silviera. is sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Thompson.
ADA Chelsea Thompson requests that Dr. Medrado report be admitted as State's Exhibit #1.  No objection from the Defense.  The Court receives the State's Exhibit #1 (will not be marked as it is a part of the record) and the Court unseals the report. 
Cross examination by attorney Gutierrez. 
The Court questions the witness. 
Attorney Gutierrez questions the witness based of the Court's questions.
The witness is excused.
Dr. Michelle Hume is sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Thompson.
ADA Thompson requests that Dr. Hume's letter to the Court be admitted as Exhibit #2.  No objection from the Defense. The Court receives The Court receives the State's Exhibit #2 (will not be marked as it is a part of the record). 
Cross examination by attorney Gutierrez.
The witness is excused. 
The State rests.

Attorney Gutierrez calls his client.
The Court notes that the Defendant forfeited his right due to his refusal to come to court.
The Defense rests.

The Court deems testimony closed at this time.

ADA Thompson presents closing arguments.
Attorney Gutierrez presents closing arguments. 

The Court places its findings on the record.
The Court adopts the findings of Dr. Andressa Medrado Bias Silviera.
The Court finds the Defendant is incompetent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate medication and treatment, is likely to become competent.
The Court orders, that the proceedings are suspended and the Defendant is committed on today's date to DHS.
The Court will further order involuntary administration of medication.

Attorney Gutierrez requests a stay to the involuntary administration of medication.
The Court denies the request. 

The State requests a hearing to test the defendant for diseases.
The Court will have her clerk schedule the hearing offer the record with the parties.

to the Court filed by ADA Chelsea Thompson regarding future dates and competency evaluation.

  **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 06/29/22-The Court will address the issue of competency in this matter at the hearing on 6/30.**

Proposed Competency Order
Motion hearing on June 15, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key with the exception of emergency purposes only or if Victim A initiates contact.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

01:13 PM Defendant Marcus Crosby in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court notes the State filed a motion to require testing and authorizing test results to be provided to the victim.  Attorney Thompson is asking for this motion to be heard as soon as possible.  DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.  The Court will set this matter before the Judge for a review on competency and set a motion hearing for next week before the Commissioner to address the State's motion.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Review hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Initial appearance on June 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:50 PM Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court.   Defendant Marcus Crosby did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court was notified that the defendant has refused to come to Court today and further has shown aggressive behaviors in the jail today.  Attorney Gutierrez requests to adjourn this matter to the trial court on their next date noting they currently have an appeal pending in cases 22CM114 and 22CM169.  The Court notes this case is not the case holding the defendant in custody.  The State would not object to adjourning this matter but would request that an initial appearance is addressed prior to the defendant being released from custody or any hold being lifted.  The Court will reset this matter one more time to Friday to check on the status of the defendant and to see if he is willing to voluntarily come to Court.  Court will address any further scheduling at the next date.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
